commentThread.commentText: At the end of the day, it really doesn't matter. Preferences based on age, race, height, weight, blah, blah, blah..People want what they want for whatever reason. The only thing you can do is look your best, put yourself out there and hope for the best in return.

I had a guy I liked, who wanted to be with me, where the only real "thing" that was driving him (not me) was if we had good sex. He said "well guys meet each other and have sex, and if it is god, they keep havin g sex, ad then they become boyfriends. In Los Angeles, it is very transient, people then to come and go, literally, so being a native, it is hard to know what to do. Where to go. Or how to actually bond - again, only a sexual bond seems to be the allure here. AND even when you find that, it is no t uncommon to have the "other" say, after some gr eat sex, as I heard, after a month of I am looking for a relationship, that in fact the :other" already had a relationship, who went back to the mid west to work in the beer family enterprise, saying "I just wanted to see if I could have an open relationship" so ... sincere guys tend to get **** over here. Is it different elsewhere?
it's a matter of preference but there is still ageism. Don't forget that if he is top he'll get him and most guys are btm.

I have noticed that when I was in my 30s, there were always a lot of young guys who wanted me. But when I was 20-25, I remember that I mainly attracted older guys. It´s kind of strage, I think. I was surprised, when I was 33-34-35 years old, that whereever I came in the ga y> community, there were always some 20 or 23 yo guy interested in me. Maybe because when you are in your 30s you still look good, but you have more knowledge and are maybe more openminded and easier to talk with than when you are 20-25.But now where I am in my 40s, I am starting to notice that it´s harder to attract young guys from 20-30. Maybe t he age gap is becoming too big. But on the other hand, I stil find a lot of 50 -60 old guys who chase me all the time LOL
You are so fucking hot. I love you
I'm 21( young and popin) I tend to like older men but I get hit on by guys in there 30 40 and 50 and in the 20 it's interesting to see how broad the age range is that I attract
I'm in my 50's ! LOL !! The great thing about that is I don't give a fuck .Its very freeing. Very chill. Nice . ✨✨👌✨✨

I'll be 32 this summer and I would date, as you said, someone 5 years older/younger than I ! I also agree with the daddy/son dynamic however there's more to a relationship than sex yet that seems to be the sole driving force for some. I also see some people dating older guys for financial gain/out of convenience! However, there are very mature 20 somethings and some very immature 40+ somethings ! Date someone that you're compatible with and be realistic as we all have flaws !! NONE of us are perfect !! Get the fantasty that's portrayed in IG/Twitter/social media out of your skull!

I honestly want my age or within 5 years older. I do not want to be the older one haha or super young in comparison. I don't understand why people wouldn't want someone there age.  I need love and emotions more then I nee d sex. Such a foreign concept in t he g>ay community. I know you asked for guys in there "30's" but I'm 29 so close enough. Oh and I date no one cause even with short hair I get mistaken f or a woman or tra ns s>o gay men don't even look at me. I don't know why bi men don't either.... guess I'm unlucky in love. Going on 30 years single.

Haa as if ageism is the only problem. Certainly not the problem I've ever run into. Guys tend to want all the same thing yet none of them fit into that thing or at least majority don't. There's so much racism and prejudice in th e g a>y community its sick. I am 29. Me personally I want someone my age or older but not more then 10 years older preferably. Not cause I'm ageist, but I want to get married and to grow old with someone not have them already be much older and die way before me. I feel as if I am only going to be so lucky to find one person I wouldn't want to live 15-20 years longer then the person I was with and be alone. That's me personally. I've liked people over 20 years older then me I've liked people11 years younger then me, but it was to much of a gap for me. I want to date guys in there 30's. Well I don't want to date plural. I just want 1 man to fall in love with me date me then one of us proposes and we have kids and live happily ever after haha

I am turning 30 this year. I would date guys in their thirties if there were open to dating me. I am not really interested in ppl in their twenties. Forties, I don't know. The last guy I dated was a transgender man who is 38.

Folks have a general idea of the kind of people they attract. I tend to attract older men in their 40s & 50s. I struggle attracting guys that are in my age range (30s). I recognized that it's the vibe one puts out or they can sense that you want a relationship. It's always the opposite effect. If you don't want something, you'll get it anyway. If you want something, you won't get it. However, if you're looking for a significant other, you may have to readjust your preferences. Our preferences is what's causing ga y> men to miss out on the opportunities to date and possibly be in a relationship. If you want a relationship, you may have to seek an older man. Or, find a guy that share the same interests and go from there. It's difficult when you're an individual that's self-aware and finding someone that is a compliment on both sides.

replies.commentText: So true! I tell many of these guys that it's going to be hard to find love if your preferences are limited to guys between 18-19..lol

commentThread.commentText: I think there's ageism, racism , sexis m, misogyny and prejudice within the >gay community. So when people say th e> "gay lifestyle" that's ignorant bec a>use gay people are not monoliths . T h>ere's gay conservatives, liberals, and people who don't fit either aforementioned label. There are just people who hold prejudices, so it '>s not a gay thing, it's an ignorant thing because I can point to examples of straight people holding the same prejudices.

10 years above or below would be the maximum for me. I don't want to be in a relationship where I feel like I have to constantly explain why something is the way it is or how something works. And neither do I want to be in a relationship where someone is constantly explaining things to me. 

FWB? Sure. But a long term committed relationship would get tedious, whether it was someone  over 10 years older or over 10 years younger. Unless! It was someone younger who was really mentally sharp and driven. Or it was someone older who was in cryosleep or a coma for 10 years and all of their knowledge about the world is 10 years behind. Either of those situations would work...
I dunno much about the dating world; but I prefer guys in their 30s than guys in their 20s. I'm 24 atm.

I'm 25 currently and while I'm not in the age range you're talking about, I have thought about this myself. Speaking for myself, I don't mind guys in their 30s because I genuinely believe that older men (and 30 isn't old in my opinion) can look great and I feel that older men know what they're looking for and are more open to actual relationships instead of constant hookups. I know that there are older men who want to play the bachelor life until they can't get it up anymore but typically, I find that older men are more open to settling down compared to younger guys. I don't attract many guys to begin with but I've noticed all too often that a lot of younger guys are only interested in hooking up as much as they can because you know, sowing the oats and whatnot. This in turn can turn off some young guys who actually want to have a relationship and thus, they may open up to older men because like I mentioned earlier, they tend to be more susceptible and open to relationships. But I also agree that it's important to have some things i n common with. I have met with a few guys significantly older than me (55 when I was 19) and the one glaring thing I've noticed is we couldn't connect on a personal basis. We both grew up at different times and different things were trending. Like for example animation, something I'm really into. He's into the cartoons that came out of the 1950s-1970s and I'm more into the stuff that came out in the late 1980s to the 2000s. Same with music. He liked Classic rock, I like 90s Alt Rock/Grunge lol So like you, ideally I'd like to find someone within my age. 5, maybe 10 years give or take. Back on the topic at hand, I do think that top/bottom can play into this as well. I've heard and seen time and again of older more dominant men trying to get younger guys and vice versa. I think it's the guys who are more versatile-minded that don't do this as much. Anyway just my own 2 cents.

replies.commentText: Kai Decadence in my experience regardless of age same shit different face.

commentThread.commentText: AGE!!!! 20's, 30's oh my god 40's!!!! You guys are so age-phobic. Sure youth is beautiful and that's what we all think we want, but I don't really remember ageism talked about that much when my husband and I were young. We were both concert pianists and met at Juilliard School of Music when we were both 21. We fell in love quickly and have been together since then. That was 1963 - eeks - ho w old.......lmao. We are now 75 and have been together for 54 years! As you can see from our picture we were both extremely handsome. However really h ot sex lasted about 20 years. Thank god we loved each other from the beginning because that has lasted and will until we die. Maybe I'll write about be ing >gay in the 60's and in love.

replies.commentText: Lavender Lust Oh, to experience what you and your husband have experienced. Unfortunately, much, and I do mean MUCH has changed since then. I don't think most guys these days can see past ten years, if that, in mosr relationships.

Not that I'd pretend to disagree with facts, Brent Foster, and at first glance it would seem you're just stating the obvious, right?. Wrong. My husband is more than 30 years older than me, and, if anything, our love has only grown stronger. Let's say "unfortunately, much, and I do mean MUCH has changed since then"..for many people. For those who follow the easy path of vain and immediate reward. In their defense, I'd say they are unaware other ways are possible out of experience and or lack of examples they could relate to. ( And I don't pose as such, I was just very lucky, huh?)

commentThread.commentText: I'm 23 and I'm totally fine with dating guys in their 30's. I find them physically attractive, and I like how they typically know what they want in life and who they are, as opposed to guys more my age who are still figuring themselves out.

The problem is more gays in the 40s which disappear completely from the system. An article was published years ago in Israel about that: "Where do the gays in the 40s disappear?" This is also an interesting subject.

replies.commentText: I am in my 40s and I find that this is a difficult age to find partners. I am too old to be young and too young to be mature LOL. People in their 50s og 60s can attract guys who want a daddy or a mature guy. While people in their 20s or 30s can attract guys who want a boyish or young looking type. When you are in your 40´s, you can´t attract those who want young guys and you can´t attract those who want a mature guy...

commentThread.commentText: I'm 33 and I have the same age range as you that I''m most likely to be interested in, but if the right guy came a long I would be open to it being outside of that range. Currently I just started seeing a guy 1 year younger than me, but my last relationship was with someone 6 years younger than me and it was precisely because we were compatible intellectually, thought each other were cute, and then sex compatibility developed. we broke up because we were just at different stages and needed to be open to moving away and we would be moving in different directions. our relationship lasted 2 years, 4 years later we are good friends. So that was just a n age gap, in an otherwise normal relationship. I haven't encountered all these 30 year olds who are only into younger guys and aren't into guys the ir age yet but I agree with Bloopity Bloop, it's probably just something that happens
Ur still handsome
